item.title: Alucinara
item.description: Overview Alucinara, or Alucinara Energy, is a type of energy characterised by the alteration of natural processes which would act differently without its influence.

item.title: Botanists

item.title: Cloud Gnats
item.description: Overview Cloud Gnats are animal-like apparitions made of alucinariferous dust. They commonly appear as small animals, standing upright with their abdomen tapering off into a wispy tail.

item.title: History
item.description: Creation At first, there was an inky void stretching on for eternity. The material of the void was Darkness, a pitch-black substance made of hydrocarbons.

item.title: History
item.description: Timekeeping The Abbreviation EA stands for ‘Event After.’ It refers to any event after the fall of the Oyhóyunol empire. The opposite abbreviation is BD, standing for ‘Before Destruction.

item.title: Ikplik
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: Minikin
item.description: Overview Minikin are a small anthropoid rodent species native to the 2nd realm. They are arboreal omnivores, biased toward eating nuts and other plants, and descend from the squirrels of the 0th realm.

item.title: Morellic Culture
item.description: Overview Morellic Culture is the culture of the morellic minikin. The name is a larger term for many related cultural-ethenic groups, all descended from a common ancestor 7,000 years ago, known as the Moráillona family.

item.title: Mushrooms
item.description: Overview Mushrooms are the fruiting bodies of many fungal species. They grow to release spores, which are released from a wide surface to be blown away by the wind.

item.title: Náiru
item.description: Overview Náiru was an ancient city in the 2nd realm, and the capitol of the Oyhóyunol Empire. Societal Structure Náiru, one of the first city-states, developed a caste system with 4 levels;

item.title: Pebble Spires
item.description: Overview Pebble Spires are a phenomenon caused when rocks interact with alucinara. They are largely benign, but can pose danger when toppled.

item.title: Sarvaran Civilisation

item.title: Sky Islands
item.description: Overview Generally, sky islands are large animal-shaped islands which float above the surface of the ground. They often feature self-sustaining ecosystems atop them, with a forest or grassland on the topside, and a rocky underside which changes shape due to Alucinara influence.

item.title: The 'Akempali Tribe
item.description: Overview The ‘Akempali1 tribe was the second group to diverge from the Moráillona family. They were spearheaded by the queen Nghoyúri2, who had helped Gesímhurën3 before.

item.title: The First Laws of Nature
item.description: %% What are the significant features which make this relevant to the plot? What patterns are there when it comes to description and properties?

item.title: The Ilorrų́nolith tribe
item.description: Overview The Ilorrų́nolith1 tribe was the group of minikin native to the south preceding the morellic migration into the area; they were made obsolete following their merging into the Ováurmith tribe.

item.title: The Morellic Tribe
item.description: Overview The Morellic tribe, known as Moréillų1, was the continuation of the Moráillona family after it grew and became larger following the destruction of the Oyhóyunol tribe.

item.title: The Moráillona Family
item.description: Overview Reputation Relationships Migration Culture

item.title: The Motúdjas Family
item.description: Overview Reputation Relationships Migration Culture

item.title: The Ováurmith Tribe
item.description: Overview The Ováurmith1 tribe began as a group of Moráillona minikin who had interbred with the Ilorrų́nolith following the southern migration.

item.title: The Oyhóyunol Tribe
item.description: Overview Reputation Relationships Migration Culture

item.title: The Petrified Child
item.description: Overview The Petrified Child1 is a supernatural being or deity concerned with the regulation and destruction of evil. It was formed from the mountains, owing to the fact that it is made of rock, and has the appearance of an infant.

item.title: The Rwaránehru Tribe
item.description: Overview The Rwaránehru1 tribe was unrelated to the Oyhóyunol tribe and the Moráillona family; in fact, they were the western natives of the equatorial lakes.

item.title: The Sníssol Tribe
item.description: Overview The Snissol[^1] tribe was the continuation of the 1st Century BD Sëniksol tribe. Reputation Relationships ‘Akempali Morellic Ǫzí Ováurmith Migration Culture

item.title: The Sëníksol Tribe
item.description: Overview Reputation Relationships Migration Culture

item.title: The Ǫzí Tribe
item.description: Overview The Ǫzí1 tribe was the result of intermingling and interbreeding of Oyhóyunol nobles on a fruitless diplomatic campaign with the Rwaránehru tribe.

item.title: Watchstones
item.description: Overview Watchstones1 are artificial patrols invented by the Sarvaran minikin for the purpose of giving The Petrified Child a greater visual range.
